Educators should ensure that student accounts are created using the student's first name and last initial only.
Educators must be mindful of who joins their class and how they will verify identities for access for students and family members.
Educators should go through their Purchasing Department to prevent avoidable charges because of the auto-renewing feature.
Educators should ensure that at the end of each school year, student accounts are deleted.

Report Educators should invite students to create accounts using their board-assigned email address. Explicit parental/guardian consent is required for children under 13 to use the app. Students are unable to share personal profile information on the web; however, educators should direct students not to include personal information or images of themselves or others in the videos they create. Educators can set up 'topics' within Flipgrid for students to contribute videos or comment on others' videos. Educators must select 'private' instead of 'public' topics, and use the 'guest password' option to permit parents access to their child's videos. Educators are responsible for making any changes/corrections to student account data. Students must submit requests through their educator for changes to the personal information in their student accounts.
Staff can add these apps via their Apple ID
